title: In an Era of Deep Polarization, Unity Is Not Trump’s Mission
summary: President Trump does not subscribe to the traditional notion of being president for all Americans.

title: After Charlie Kirk Killing, Suspect Joked That His ‘Doppelganger’ Did It
summary: Before he was arrested on suspicion of carrying out the assassination, 22-year-old Tyler Robinson sent friends messages showing that he was closely following news about the killing.

title: Erika Kirk, Charlie Kirk’s Widow, Grieves Publicly, Melding Personal and Political
summary: Ms. Kirk has played a key role in her husband’s movement. Speaking at Turning Point USA headquarters and on social media, she pledged his work would continue.

title: Russia Made Drone Production a Supreme Priority. Now It Swarms the Skies.
summary: Ukraine is struggling to defend itself against the growing number of attack drones that Moscow has started using in its onslaughts.

title: Ukrainian Drones Strike Major Russian Oil Refinery
summary: The strike came hours after Romania said a Russian drone had flown through its airspace. The incidents further underscored how drones were making the war in Ukraine felt outside the country’s borders.

title: Trump’s Reversals on Immigration Mount Over Economic Concerns
summary: President Trump has walked back some significant immigration policies that collide with his economic agenda, angering his far-right allies.

title: In Some Records, Fed Governor Lisa Cook Listed Atlanta Home as Secondary
summary: In a court filing, lawyers for Lisa Cook cited a news story about the records and urged a federal court to rule against President Trump’s efforts to block her from an upcoming Fed meeting.

title: U.S. and China to Resume Talks on Tariffs, TikTok in Madrid
summary: Economic officials meeting in Madrid will seek to head off a November tariff deadline.

title: Federal Judge Questions Deportations to Ghana
summary: A hearing in the case of five migrants deported to Ghana last week showed how earlier Supreme Court rulings have paved the way for President Trump’s mass deportation campaign.

title: Arab Ministers Gather to Decide Response to Israeli Attack in Qatar
summary: Arab foreign ministers were expected to meet on Sunday in the Qatari capital, Doha, to lay the groundwork for a summit there on Monday.

title: Finding God in the App Store
summary: Millions of people are turning to chatbots to confess their darkest secrets and seek guidance from on high. “Is this actually God I am talking to?”

title: Robert Munsch, the Beloved Children’s Author Whose Stories Are Slipping Away
summary: Robert Munsch wrote “The Paper Bag Princess,” “Love You Forever” and other classics by performing them over and over for kids. But dementia is now stealing his imagination.

title: Inside a ‘Hell on Earth’ in Oklahoma
summary: The Greer Center was supposed to be a refuge for people with developmental disabilities. But accounts from inside the secretive facility paint a starkly different picture, depicting a place where helpless patients faced beatings, waterboarding and constant fear.

title: How Nancy Pelosi Quietly Shaped California’s Redistricting Fight
summary: Private meetings and longtime loyalties helped push what began as a something of a Democratic bluff into a full-fledged counteroffensive against President Trump.

title: Lina Khan Revamped Antitrust. Now She’s Pushing the Democratic Party.
summary: The youngest chair in the history of the Federal Trade Commission is campaigning for Zohran Mamdani and defending her brand of populism.

title: Van Hollen Criticizes Democratic Leaders for Delay in Endorsing Mamdani
summary: At an annual fund-raiser in Iowa, the Maryland Democrat said he supported Zohran Mamdani for mayor of New York City and said people were sick of “spineless politics.”

title: On the Supreme Court’s Emergency Docket, Sharp Partisan Divides
summary: The second Trump administration has filed roughly the same number of applications so far as the Biden administration did over four years. But they have fared quite differently.

title: What to Expect at the 2025 Emmy Awards
summary: The Apple TV+ series “Severance” and the HBO Max medical show “The Pitt” are in a tight race for best drama, television’s most coveted prize.

title: Emmys 2025: How to Watch, Time and Streaming
summary: The show, airing on CBS, is being hosted by the comedian Nate Bargatze.

title: After Bolsonaro’s Conviction, Brazil Already Considers His Amnesty
summary: Brazil’s top court sentenced former President Jair Bolsonaro to 27 years in prison. The nation’s Congress is already debating how to free him.

title: Tyler Robinson and Our Poisonous Internet
summary: We’ve fully stepped into a different historical moment: the age of brain-poisoning meme politics.

title: Democrats Cannot Just Buy Back the Working Class
summary: Why did the working class switch sides?

title: The Capital of Electric Cars Is Turning to Electric Planes
summary: There are dozens of short daily flights to Norway’s islands, and the oil-producing Scandinavian country wants electricity to power them.

title: Funicular Crash Has Jarred Lisbon’s Sense of Itself
summary: Lisbon has transformed itself in recent years into a destination for international investors. A funicular crash that killed 16 people has prompted soul-searching about the changes in the city.

title: The German Elections That Are Set to Test the Attraction of the Far Right
summary: A municipal vote in the state of North Rhine-Westphalia will be a gauge of the national mood since Chancellor Friedrich Merz took office.
